solution_line_template: After eating {green_macaroons_eaten} green macaroons, the number is reduced to {initial_green_macaroons} green macaroons - {green_macaroons_eaten} green macaroons = {remaining_green_macaroons} green macaroons

If Fran ate {green_macaroons_eaten} green macaroons, he also ate {multiplier_red_macaroons} red/green * {green_macaroons_eaten} green macaroons = <<{green_macaroons_eaten}*{multiplier_red_macaroons}={red_macaroons_eaten}>>{red_macaroons_eaten} red macaroons.

The total number of red macaroons remaining is {initial_red_macaroons} red macaroons - {red_macaroons_eaten} red macaroons = <<{initial_red_macaroons}-{red_macaroons_eaten}={remaining_red_macaroons}>>{remaining_red_macaroons} red macaroons

The total number of macaroons Fran has left are {remaining_red_macaroons} macaroons + {remaining_green_macaroons} macaroons = <<{remaining_red_macaroons}+{remaining_green_macaroons}={total_remaining_macaroons}>>{total_remaining_macaroons} macaroons
